ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.1_0: Reverence to him, the Fortunate One, the Worthy One, the Perfect Sambuddha
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.2_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.3_0: At that time the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha. They then went to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they said to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.6_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.1.9_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.1_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.2_0: “How can the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.5_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.8_0: and in this way start new quarrels and make existing quarrels worse?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.10_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.11_0: “Is it true that the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.14_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.17_0: and in this way start new quarrels and make existing quarrels worse?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.20_0: It’s not suitable for those foolish men, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.21_0: “... How can those foolish men act like this?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.22_0: one who creates legal issues in the Sangha ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.23_0: the Sangha and say that legal issues against them is
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.26_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.29_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.30_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it or increase the confidence of those who have it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.2.31_0: but it will hinder confidence in those without it and it will cause some with confidence to change their minds.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.3.1_0: Then the Buddha spoke in many ways in dispraise of being difficult to support and maintain, in dispraise of great desires, discontent, socializing, and laziness; but he spoke in many ways in praise of being easy to support and maintain, of fewness of wishes, contentment, self-elimination, ascetic practices, serenity, reduction in things, and of being energetic. After giving a teaching on what is right and proper, he addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.3.2_0: “Well then, monks, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.2_0: First you should accuse the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They should then be reminded of what they have done, before they are charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.4_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha. They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.7_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.10_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.11_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.13_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.14_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.15_0: and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.16_0: They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.19_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.22_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.23_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.24_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.25_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.26_0: For the second time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.27_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.28_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.29_0: and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.30_0: They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.33_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.36_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.37_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.38_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.39_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.40_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.41_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.42_0: These monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are quarrelsome, argumentative,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.43_0: and creators of legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.44_0: They go to other monks who are also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and they say to them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.47_0: You’re wiser, more competent, more learned, and more capable than he.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.50_0: so that new quarrels start and existing quarrels become worse?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.51_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.52_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.53_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.54_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:1.4.55_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.1_0: “Monks, when a legal procedure of condemnation has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.3_0: When a legal procedure of condemnation has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.4_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done against one who has confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.6_0: When a legal procedure of condemnation has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:2.1.8_0: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:3.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of condemnation has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:3.1.2_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:3.1.3_0: When a legal procedure of condemnation has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:3.1.4_0: When a procedure of condemnation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:3.1.5_0: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:3.1.6_0: When a legal procedure of condemnation has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.2_0: he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.3_0: he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.4_0: he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.5_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.6_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.7_0: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.8_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.9_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.10_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.1.11_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of condemnation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.1_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.2_0: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.3_0: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.4_0: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.5_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.6_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.7_0: those who have failed in the higher morality; those who have failed in conduct; those who have failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.8_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.9_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.10_0: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.11_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of condemnation against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:4.2.12_0: The group of six on wishing is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of condemnation done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.3_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.4_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.5_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.6_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.9_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.10_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.11_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.12_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.13_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.14_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.15_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.16_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.17_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.18_0: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.19_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.20_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:5.1.21_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of condemnation are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.0_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.1_0: When the Sangha had done a legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.2_0: they conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. They then went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.3_0: and told them about this, adding, “What should we do now?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.4_0: who in turn told the Buddha. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.1.6_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.1_0: When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.2_0: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.3_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.7_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he speaks to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he makes accusations against a regular monk; he asks a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:6.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.0_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.2_0: he does not give the full ordination; he does not give formal support; he does not have a novice monk attend on him; he does not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he does not instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.3_0: A monk who has these five qualities should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.5_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of condemnation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.6_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.7_0: A monk who has these five qualities should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.9_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he doesn’t make accusations against a regular monk; he doesn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of condemnation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:7.1.11_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.1_0: “And this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.2_0: After approaching the Sangha, the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should put their upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on their heels, raise their joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against this monk—who is conducting themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.1.6_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.1_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.2_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They have conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.3_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.5_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.6_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They have conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.7_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.8_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.9_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.10_0: For the second time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.11_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.12_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They have conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.13_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.14_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.15_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.16_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.17_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.18_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of condemnation against these monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka. They have conducted themselves properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now ask for the legal procedure of condemnation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.19_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.20_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.21_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.22_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of condemnation against the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.23_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:8.2.24_0: The first section on the legal procedure of condemnation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.1_0: At that time Venerable Seyyasaka was ignorant and incompetent. He had committed an offense heavy offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.2_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.3_0: Moreover, the monks regularly give him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.4_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.5_0: “How can Venerable Seyyasaka go on like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.6_0: How can he constantly and improperly socialize with householders?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.7_0: Moreover, the monks regularly give him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.9_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.10_0: “Is it true that the monk Seyyasaka goes on like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.11_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.12_0: Moreover, the monks regularly give him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.15_0: “It’s not suitable for that foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.16_0: How can he be ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.17_0: How can he constantly and improperly socialize with householders?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.18_0: Moreover, the monks regularly give him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.19_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.21_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.22_0: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.1.23_0: instructing him to live with formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.1_0: And it should be done like this.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Seyyasaka. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.4_0: This monk is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.5_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.6_0: Moreover, the monks regularly give him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.7_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.8_0: instructing him to live with formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.10_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.11_0: This monk is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.12_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.13_0: Moreover, the monks regularly give him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.14_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.15_0: instructing him to live with formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.16_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.17_0: instructing him to live with formal support, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.18_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.20_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.21_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.22_0: This monk is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.23_0: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.24_0: Moreover, the monks regularly give him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.25_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.26_0: instructing him to live with formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.27_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.28_0: instructing him to live with formal support, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.29_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.30_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.31_0: instructing him to live with formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:9.2.32_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of demotion has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.3_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.4_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done against one who has confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.6_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.7_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.8_0: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.9_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.10_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.11_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.12_0: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.13_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.14_0: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.18_0: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven. ...

ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.29_0: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.30_0: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.31_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.33_0: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.34_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.35_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.37_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures is finished.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.67_0: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.68_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.69_0: it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.70_0: Someone with these three qualities is raised up to heaven. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.71_0: When a procedure of demotion has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.72_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.73_0: When a legal procedure of demotion has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.74_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.75.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.76_0: he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.77_0: he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.78_0: he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.79_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.80_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.81_0: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.82_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.83_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.84_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.85_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of demotion against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.86_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.87_0: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.88_0: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.89_0: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.90_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.91_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.92_0: those who have failed in the higher morality; those who have failed in conduct; those who have failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.93_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.94_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.95_0: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.96_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of demotion against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.97_0: The group of six on wishing is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.98.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of demotion done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.100_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.101_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.102_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.103_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.104_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.105_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.106_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.107_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.108_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.109_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.110_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.111_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.112_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.113_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.114_0: He should not ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.115_0: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.116_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.117_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:10.1.118_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of demotion are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.1_0: Soon the Sangha did a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.2_0: instructing him to live with formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.3_0: Then, by associating with good friends, by having them recite, and by questioning them, he became learned and a master of the tradition; he became an expert on the Teaching, the Monastic Law, and the summaries; he became knowledgeable and competent, had a sense of conscience, and was afraid of wrongdoing and fond of the training.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.4_0: And he conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He then went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.7_0: who in turn told the Buddha. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.1.9_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.0_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.1_0: When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.2_0: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.3_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.7_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he speaks to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he makes accusations against a regular monk; he asks a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.12.0_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.12.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.13_0: he does not give the full ordination; he does not give formal support; he does not have a novice monk attend on him; he does not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he does not instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.14_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.15_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.16_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of demotion against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.17_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.18_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.19_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.20_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he doesn’t make accusations against a regular monk; he doesn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.21_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of demotion against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:11.2.22_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.1_0: “And this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.2_0: After approaching the Sangha, the monk Seyyasaka should put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against me, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of demotion to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.1_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.2_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.3_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of demotion to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.4_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.6_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.7_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of demotion to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.8_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.9_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.10_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.11_0: For the second time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.12_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.13_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of demotion to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.14_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.15_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.16_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.17_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.18_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.19_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of demotion to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.20_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.21_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.22_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.23_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of demotion against the monk Seyyasaka.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.24_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:12.2.25_0: The second section on the legal procedure of demotion is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.1_0: At one time Assaji and Punabbasuka were the resident monks at Kīṭāgiri. They were bad and shameless.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.2_0: and they were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.3_0: They planted flowering trees, water them ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.4_0: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughter-in-laws, and the female slaves of good families.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.5_0: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.6_0: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.7_0: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.1.8_0: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.1_0: They played various games: board games with eight and ten rows, imaginary board games, hopscotch, spillikins, dice games, tip-cat, painting-with-the-hand games, ball games, toy-pipe games, toy-plow games, turning somersaults, toy-windmill games, toy-measure games, toy-carriage games, toy-bow games, letter-guessing games, thought-guessing gamessing deformities.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.2_0: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.3_0: And they ran in front of elephants, in front of horses, and in front of carriages, and they ran backwards and forwards.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.4_0: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.5_0: They spread their outer robes on a stage and said to the dancing girls,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.7_0: and they made gestures of approval.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.2.8_0: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.1_0: Just then a certain monk who had completed the rains residence in Kāsī was on his way to visit the Buddha at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.2_0: In the morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Kīṭāgiri to collect almsfood. He was pleasing in the way he entered and returned, in looking at and in looking away, in bending and stretching out his arms; his eyes were lowered, and he was perfect in deportment.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.3_0: When people saw him, they said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.4_0: “Who is this, acting like a fool, like a dullard, continuously frowning?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.5_0: Who will give almsfood to him?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.6_0: Almsfood should instead be given to our Venerables Assaji and Punabbasuka, for they are gentle, congenial, pleasant to speak with, greeting one with a smile, welcoming, friendly, open, the first to speak.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.7_0: The alms-food should be given to them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.8_0: a certain lay follower saw him wandering for alms.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.9_0: He approached him, bowed, and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.3.11_0: “It’s not possible that Piṇḍola Bhāradvāja gains.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.1_0: He took that monk to his house and gave him a meal.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.3_0: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.4_0: “Well then, would you please pay respect at the feet of the Buddha in my name and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.5_0: ‘Venerable Sir, the monastery in Kīṭāgiri has been corrupted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.6_0: Assaji and Punabbasuka are the resident monks there. They are bad and shameless,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.7_0: and they were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.8_0: They planted flowering trees, water them ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.9_0: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughter-in-laws, and the female slaves of good families.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.10_0: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.11_0: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.12_0: The permutation series is to be expanded.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.14_0: They played various games: board games with eight and ten rows, imaginary board games, hopscotch, spillikins, dice games, tip-cat, painting-with-the-hand games, ball games, toy-pipe games, toy-plow games, turning somersaults, toy-windmill games, toy-measure games, toy-carriage games, toy-bow games, letter-guessing games, thought-guessing gamessing deformities.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.15_0: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.16_0: And they ran in front of elephants, in front of horses, and in front of carriages, and they ran backwards and forwards.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.17_0: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.18_0: They spread their outer robes on a stage and said to the dancing girls,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.20_0: and they made gestures of approval.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.21_0: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.22_0: Those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.23_0: that there is no longer any support for the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.24_0: and that the good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.4.25_0: Sir, please send monks to stay at the monastery at Kīṭāgiri.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.1_0: The monk consented, got up from his seat, and left for Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.2_0: When he eventually arrived at Sāvatthī, he went to the Buddha in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.3_0: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.5_0: “I hope you are keeping well, monk, I hope you’re comfortable;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.6_0: I hope you’re not tired from traveling.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.7_0: And where have you come from?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.8_0: “I can bear up, Fortunate One, I can carry on, Fortunate One,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.10_0: He then told the Buddha all that had happened at Kīṭāgiri,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.11_0: Then I robed up in the morning and, taking my bowl and robe, entered Kīṭāgiri for alms.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.12_0: The lay followers saw me as Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.15_0: ‘No, reverend, one isn’t gained any alms.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.17_0: That lay follower took me to his house and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.19_0: ‘I’m going to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.20_0: ‘Well then, would you please pay respect at the feet of the Buddha in my name and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.21_0: “Venerable Sir, the monastery in Kīṭāgiri has been corrupted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.22_0: Assaji and Punabbasuka are the resident monks there. They are bad and shameless,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.23_0: and they were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.25_0: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.26_0: Those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.27_0: that there is no longer any support for the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.28_0: and that the good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.29_0: Sir, please send monks to stay at the monastery at Kīṭāgiri.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.5.30_0: and finished by saying, “That’s where I’ve come from.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.1_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.2_0: “Is it true, monks, that the bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are misbehaving like this at Kīṭāgiri?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.3_0: and they were misbehaving in this way:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.5_0: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.6_0: And is it true that those people who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.7_0: that there is no longer any support for the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.8_0: and that the good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on?”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.30_0: he gave a teaching and addressed Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Moggallāna:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.31_0: “Sāriputta, the two of you should go and do a legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from Kīṭāgiri.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.6.32_0: “Sir, how can we do a procedure of banishing these monks from Kīṭāgiri? They are temperamental and harsh.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.1_0: “And this is how it should be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.2_0: First you should accuse the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka. They should then be reminded of what they have done, before they are charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.4_0: These monks, Assaji and Punabbasuka, are corrupters of families and badly behaved.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.5_0: Their bad behavior is seen and heard about,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.6_0: and the families corrupted by them are seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.7_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of banishing them from Kīṭāgiri,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.8_0: prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.10_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.13_0: and the families corrupted by them are seen and heard about.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.14_0: The Sangha is doing a legal procedure of banishing them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.15_0: prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.16_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of banishing them from Kīṭāgiri, prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.17_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.19_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.20_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.27_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.29_0: prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:13.7.30_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.3_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.4_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done against one who has confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.8_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.9_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.10_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.11_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.12_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.13_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.17_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.20_0: When a legal procedure of banishment has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.22_0: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.36_0: he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.37_0: he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.38_0: he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.40_0: “When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.1.41_0: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.
