ai-pli-tv-kd11:14.2.24_0: The group of fourteen on wishing is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of banishment done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.3_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.4_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.5_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.6_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.9_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.10_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.11_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.12_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.13_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.14_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.15_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.16_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.17_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.18_0: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.19_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.20_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:15.1.21_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of banishment are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.1_0: Soon afterwards a sangha of monks headed by Venerable Sāriputta and Venerable Moggallāna went to Kīṭāgiri and did the legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.2_0: prohibiting the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka from staying at Kīṭāgiri.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.3_0: After the Sangha had done the procedure, those monks did not conduct themselves properly or suitably so as to deserve to be released,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.4_0: nor did they ask the monks for forgiveness. Instead they abused and reviled them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.5_0: and they slandered them as acting from desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.6_0: And they left and they disrobed.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.8_0: “When the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing them, how can these monks act like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.9_0: nor will they ask the monks forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.10_0: and they’ll slander enthusiasm, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.11_0: they’ll leave and have no more.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.13_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.14_0: “Is it true, monks, that when the Sangha had done a procedure of banishing them, the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.15_0: nor did they ask the monks for forgiveness. Instead they abused and reviled them,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.16_0: and they slandered them as acting from desire, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.21_0: How can these foolish men act like this when the Sangha had done a procedure of banishing them?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.22_0: nor will they ask the monks forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.23_0: and they’ll slander enthusiasm, ill will, confusion, and fear.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.27_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.1.28_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of banishment.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.0_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.2_0: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.3_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.7_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he speaks to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he makes accusations against a regular monk; he asks a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.12.0_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.12.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.13_0: he does not give the full ordination; he does not give formal support; he does not have a novice monk attend on him; he does not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he does not instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.14_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.15_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.16_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of banishing him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.17_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.18_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.19_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.20_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he doesn’t make accusations against a regular monk; he doesn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.21_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of banishing him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:16.2.22_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.1_0: “And this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.2_0: After approaching the Sangha, the monk who has had a legal procedure of banishment done against himself should put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing me, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.1.6_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.1_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.2_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.3_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of banishing him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.5_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.6_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.7_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of banishing him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.8_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.9_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.11_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.12_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.13_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of banishment to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.14_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of banishing him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.15_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.16_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.17_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of banishing monk so-and-so.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.18_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:17.2.19_0: The second section on the legal procedure of banishment is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.1_0: At one time Venerable Sudhamma was the resident monk at the householder Citta’s monastery at Macchikāsaṇḍa. He was in charge of the building work and received a regular supply of food.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.2_0: When Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from Sudhamma.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.3_0: On one occasion a number of senior monks—Venerable Sāriputta, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, Venerable Mahākaccāna, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhika, Venerable Mahākappina, Venerable Mahācunda, Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Revata, Venerable Upāli, Venerable Ānanda, Venerable Rāhula—were wandering in Kāsī, when they arrived at Macchikāsaṇḍa.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.4_0: When Citta heard that they had arrived,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.5_0: he went to them, bowed, and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.6_0: After Sāriputta had instructed, inspired, and gladdened Citta with a teaching,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.1.8_0: “Venerables, please accept a meal for new arrivals from me tomorrow.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.1_0: When he knew that they had accepted, Citta got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated them with his right side toward them, and went to Sudhamma. He bowed to him
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.3_0: “Venerable, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.5_0: “Previously when Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from me.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.6_0: But now he has invited the senior monks without my permission.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.7_0: He’s been corrupted, this Citta. He’s uninterested and has no affection for me.” He said to Citta,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.11_0: “Venerable, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.2.14_0: “What difference does it make to me whether Sudhamma accepts or not?” He then bowed down, circumambulated Sudhamma with his right side toward him, and left.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.1_0: The following morning Citta prepared various kinds of fine food for the senior monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.3_0: “Let me go and see what Citta has prepared for the senior monks.” He then robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Citta’s house, where he sat down on a prepared seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.4_0: Citta approached Sudhamma, bowed, and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.6_0: “You have prepared many kinds of fine food.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.7_0: But there’s one that’s missing: sesame cookies.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.8_0: “Venerable Sir, I have spoken what the Buddha is so very well spoken by the Buddha. Whatever she speaks of Dhamma is so sesame, cookies?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.9_0: Formerly there were some traders from the south who went to an eastern country to trade.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.10_0: From there they brought back a hen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.11_0: That hen mated with a crow
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.13_0: When that chick wanted to caw like a crow, it cried, ‘caw-ca-doodle-doo.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.14_0: And when that chick wanted to crow like a rooster, it cried, ‘cock-a-doodle-caw.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.3.15_0: In the same way, when there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, you speak of sesame cookies.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.1_0: “You can abuse, householder, you can abuse me,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.5_0: for the Wild Mango Grove is lovely.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.6_0: I’ll do my best to supply you with robes, almsfood, a dwelling, and medicines.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.8_0: When Sudhamma repeated it a third time,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.9_0: “You can abuse, householder, you can abuse me,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.12_0: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to visit the Buddha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.13_0: “Well then, please tell the Buddha of our entire conversation.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.4.14_0: But it wouldn’t be surprised that the target is included in return.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.1_0: Sudhamma put his dwelling in order, took his bowl and robe, and left for Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.2_0: When he eventually arrived at Sāvatthī, he went to the Buddha in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha and sat down.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.3_0: and told him about the conversation he had with Citta.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.5_0: “It’s not suitable, foolish man, it’s not proper, it’s not worthy of an ascetic, it’s not allowable, it’s not to be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.6_0: How can you demean and insult Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.7_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.9_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.10_0: “Well then, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.5.11_0: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.1_0: And this is how it should be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Sudhamma. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.4_0: The monk Sudhamma has demeaned and insulted the householder Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.6_0: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.8_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.9_0: The monk Sudhamma has demeaned and insulted the householder Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.10_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.11_0: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.12_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma, instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.13_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.15_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.16_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.17_0: The monk Sudhamma has demeaned and insulted the householder Citta, who has faith and confidence, who is a donor and benefactor, and a supporter of the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.18_0: The Sangha does a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.19_0: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.20_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma, instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.21_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.22_0: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.23_0: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:18.6.24_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.3_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.4_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done against one who has confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.8_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.9_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.10_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.11_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.12_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.13_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.14_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.15_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.16_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.17_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.20_0: When a legal procedure of reconciliation has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, and it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.21_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.22_0: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.25_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.26_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the admission of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.27_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.28_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.29_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.30_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.31_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.32_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.33_0: When a legal procedure of reconciliation has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, and it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:19.1.34_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.2_0: They try to prevent the lay people from getting material possessions. They try to harm lay people. They insult and abuse lay people. They divide lay people against each other. They abuse lay people against each other. They cause division.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.3_0: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against these five qualities:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.5_0: he disparages the Buddha to householders; he disparages the Teaching to householders; he disparages the Sangha to householders; he demeans and insults householders; he doesn’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.6_0: The Saṅgha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against these five qualities:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.7_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.8_0: those who are trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; those who are trying to harm householders; those who are trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; those who abuse and revile householders; those who cause division between householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.9_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against these five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.10_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against another five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.11_0: those who disparage the Buddha to householders; those who disparage the Teaching to householders; those who disparage the Sangha to householders; those who demean and insult householders; those who don’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.12_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against these five kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:20.1.13_0: The group of four on wishing is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.3_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.4_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.5_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.6_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.9_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.10_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.11_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.12_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.13_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.14_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.15_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.16_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.17_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.18_0: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.19_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.20_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:21.1.21_0: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of reconciliation are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.1_0: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.2_0: instructing him to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.3_0: He then went to Macchikāsaṇḍa and did not ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.7_0: and he told them what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.1.8_0: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.1_0: “Well then, the Sangha should give a companion messenger to Sudhamma
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.3_0: And it should be given like this:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.4_0: First a monk should be asked, and then a competent and capable monk should inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.5_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.6_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.8_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.9_0: The Sangha gives monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.10_0: Any monk who approves of giving monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.11_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.12_0: The Sangha has given monk so-and-so to Sudhamma as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.2.13_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.1_0: “Sudhamma should now go to Macchikāsaṇḍa with that monk as a companion messenger to ask Citta for forgiveness, saying,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.3_0: If he then speaks like this, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.4_0: If not, the companion messenger should say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.6_0: If he then speaks like this, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.7_0: If not, the companion messenger should say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.8_0: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I’m rebuking him.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.9_0: If he then speaks like this, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.10_0: If not, the companion messenger should say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.11_0: ‘Please forgive this monk, householder; I ask in the name of the Sangha.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.12_0: If he then speaks like this, all is well.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:22.3.13_0: If not, then a monk who approves of charming them should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and pay respect at the feet of a pot. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and make amends for it.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.1_0: Sudhamma then went to Macchikāsaṇḍa with that householder’s mind.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.2_0: He then conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.5_0: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.1.6_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.0_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.2_0: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.3_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.4_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.7_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.8_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.9_0: he cancels the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he cancels the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he speaks to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he makes accusations against a regular monk; he asks a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he accuses a regular monk of an offense; he reminds a regular monk of an offense; he associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.10_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.11_0: The group of eighteen on not to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.12.0_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.12.1_0: “When a monk has five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.13_0: he does not give the full ordination; he does not give formal support; he does not have a novice monk attend on him; he does not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he does not instruct the nuns, whether appointed or not.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.14_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.15_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.16_0: he doesn’t commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him; he doesn’t commit an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.17_0: he doesn’t criticize the procedure; he doesn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.18_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.19_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.20_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he doesn’t make accusations against a regular monk; he doesn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.21_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of reconciliation against him should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:23.2.22_0: The group of eighteen on to be lifted is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.1_0: “And this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.2_0: The monk Sudhamma should approach the Sangha, put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against me, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.6_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.7_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.8_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.9_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of reconciliation against Sudhamma.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.11_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.12_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.13_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of reconciliation against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.14_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.15_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.17_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.18_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.19_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of reconciliation to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.20_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of reconciliation against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.21_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.22_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.23_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of reconciliation against the monk Sudhamma.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.24_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:24.1.25_0: The fourth section on the legal procedure of reconciliation is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.0_0: The legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.2_0: At that time Venerable Channa had committed an offense, but refused to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.4_0: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to recognize it?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.6_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that Channa is acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.11_0: How can Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to recognize it?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.14_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.15_0: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.1.16_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.1_0: And this is how it should be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Channa. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.4_0: The monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.5_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.6_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.8_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.9_0: The monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.10_0: The Sangha is doing a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.11_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.12_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.13_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.14_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.16_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.17_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.18_0: The monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to recognize it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.19_0: The Sangha is doing a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.20_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.21_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.22_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.23_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.24_0: The Sangha has done the legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.25_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.26_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.27_0: Monks, you should proclaim from monastery to monastery
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.28_0: that the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:25.2.29_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.3_0: When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has these three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.4_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done against one who has confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.8_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without questioning the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.9_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without the admission of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.10_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.11_0: When a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.12_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done against one who has confessed their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.13_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.14_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.15_0: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.16_0: When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has these three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.17_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.20_0: When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.21_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.22_0: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.25_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.26_0: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done with the admission of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.27_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.28_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.29_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.30_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.31_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.32_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having charged the person with their offense, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.33_0: When a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has these three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.34_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.35.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.36_0: he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.37_0: he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.38_0: he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.39_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.40_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.41_0: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.42_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.43_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.44_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.45_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.46_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.47_0: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.48_0: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.49_0: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.50_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.51_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.52_0: those who have failed in the higher morality; those who have failed in conduct; those who have failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.53_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.54_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.55_0: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.56_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:26.1.57_0: The group of six on wishing in regard to a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.3_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.4_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.5_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.6_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.7_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.8_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.9_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.10_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.11_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.12_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.13_0: he doesn’t bow to a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.14_0: Regular monks standing up for him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.15_0: Regular monks raising their joined palms to him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.16_0: Regular monks doing acts of respect toward him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.17_0: He should not consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.18_0: Regular monks offering him a bed;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.19_0: Regular monks offering him water for washing his feet and a foot-stool;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.20_0: Regular monks offering him a foot-scraper;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.21_0: Regular monks receiving his bowl and robe;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.22_0: he should not massage one another when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.23_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in morality.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.24_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.25_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.26_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.27_0: He should not cause division between monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.28_0: He should not wear lay clothes.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.29_0: he should not wear the ascetics of another religion.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.30_0: He should not associate with the ascetics of other religions.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.32_0: He should train in the monks’ training.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.33_0: He should not stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.34_0: He should not, in a non-monastery, stay in the same room as a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.35_0: He should not, in a monastery or a non-monastery, stay in the same room as a more senior monk deserving rehabilitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.36_0: If he sees a regular monk, he should get up from his seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.37_0: he should not dismiss a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.38_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.39_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.40_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.41_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.42_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.43_0: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.44_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.45_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:27.1.46_0: The forty-three kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.1_0: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.2_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.3_0: He then left that monastery and went to another one.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.4_0: The monks there did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, and esteem him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.5_0: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.6_0: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, and esteem him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.7_0: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.8_0: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, and esteem him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.9_0: Because of this, he left that monastery too and returned to Kosambī.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.10_0: He then conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.13_0: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.1.14_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.0_0: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted

ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.2_0: he gives the full ordination; he gives formal support; he has a novice monk attend on him; he accepts being appointed as an instructor of the nuns; he instructs the nuns, whether appointed or not.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.5_0: he commits the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he commits an offense similar to the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense; he commits an offense worse than the one for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.6_0: he criticizes the procedure; he criticizes those who did the procedure. ...

ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.10_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.11_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.12_0: he consents to a regular monk offering him a bed; he consents to a regular monk offering him water for washing his feet and a foot-stool; he consents to a regular monk offering him a foot-scraper; he consents to a regular monk receiving his bowl and robe; he consents to a regular monk massaging his back when bathing.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.14_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.15_0: he charges a regular monk with failure in morality; he charges a regular monk with failure in conduct; he charges a regular monk with failure in view; he charges a regular monk with failure in livelihood; he causes division between monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.16_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.17_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.18_0: he wears lay clothes; he wears the robes of the ascetics of other religions; he associates with the ascetics of other religions;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.19_0: he doesn’t associate with monks; he doesn’t train in the monks’ training.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.20_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.21_0: When a monk has another five qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.22_0: he stays in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a non-monastery as a regular monk; he stays in the same room in a monastery or a non-monastery as a regular monk;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.23_0: he doesn’t get up from his seat when he sees a regular monk;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.24_0: he dismisses a regular monk, whether inside or outside a dwelling.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.25_0: When a monk has these five qualities, a legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.26_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.28_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense should not be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:28.2.29_0: The group of forty-three on not to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.1_0: “And this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.2_0: The monk Channa should approach the Sangha, put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.3_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not recognizing an offense, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.4_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.6_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.7_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.8_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense, but he has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.9_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.11_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.12_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense, but he has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.13_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.14_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.15_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.17_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.18_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.19_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not recognizing an offense, but he has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.20_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.21_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.22_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.23_0: The Sangha has lifted the legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.24_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:30.1.25_0: The fifth section on the legal procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.0_0: The legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.2_0: At this time Venerable Channa had committed an offense, but refused to make amends for it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.3_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.4_0: “How can Venerable Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to make amends for it?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.6_0: Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.7_0: “Is it true, monks, that Channa is acting like this?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.11_0: How can Channa commit an offense, but then refuse to make amends for it?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.12_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.14_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.15_0: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.16_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.17_0: And this is how it should be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.18_0: First you should accuse the monk Channa. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.19_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.20_0: The monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to make amends for it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.21_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.22_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.24_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.25_0: The monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to make amends for it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.26_0: The Sangha is doing a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.27_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.28_0: Any monk who approves of doing a legal procedure of ejecting Channa for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.29_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha, should remain silent.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.30_0: Any monk who doesn’t agree should speak up.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.32_0: For the third time I speak on this matter.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.33_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.34_0: The monk Channa has committed an offense, but refuses to make amends for it.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.46.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.47_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.48_0: When a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense has another three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.80.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.81_0: he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.82_0: he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.83_0: he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.84_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.85_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.86_0: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.87_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.89_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.90_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.93_0: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.94_0: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
