ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.103.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.105_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.106_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.107_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.108_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.109_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.110_0: He should not commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.111_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.112_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.113_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.114_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.115_0: he doesn’t bow to a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.116_0: Regular monks standing up for him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.117_0: Regular monks raising their joined palms to him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.118_0: Regular monks doing acts of respect toward him;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.119_0: He should not consent to a regular monk offering him a seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.120_0: Regular monks offering him a bed;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.121_0: Regular monks offering him water for washing his feet and a foot-stool;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.122_0: Regular monks offering him a foot-scraper;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.123_0: Regular monks receiving his bowl and robe;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.124_0: he should not massage one another when bathing.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.125_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in morality.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.126_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in conduct.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.127_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.128_0: He should not charge a regular monk with failure in livelihood.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.129_0: He should not cause division between monks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.130_0: He should not wear lay clothes.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.131_0: he should not wear the ascetics of another religion.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.132_0: He should not associate with the ascetics of other religions.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.134_0: He should train in the monks’ training.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.135_0: He should not stay in the same room in a monastery as a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.136_0: He should not, in a non-monastery, stay in the same room as a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.137_0: He should not, in a monastery or a non-monastery, stay in the same room as a more senior monk deserving rehabilitation.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.138_0: If he sees a regular monk, he should get up from his seat.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.139_0: he should not dismiss a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.140_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.141_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.142_0: He should not speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.143_0: He should not make accusations against a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.144_0: A nun should not ask a monk for permission to accuse him of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.145_0: He should not accuse a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.146_0: He should not remind a regular monk of an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.147_0: He should not associates inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.148_0: The forty-three kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense are finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.149_0: Soon afterwards the Sangha did a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.150_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.151_0: He then left that monastery and went to another one.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.152_0: The monks there did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, and esteem him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.153_0: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.154_0: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, and esteem him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.155_0: Because of this, he left that monastery too and went to yet another one.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.156_0: There too the monks did not bow down to him, stand up for him, raise their joined palms to him, or do acts of respect toward him. They did not honor, respect, and esteem him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.157_0: Because of this, he left that monastery too and returned to Kosambī.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.158_0: He then conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. He went to the monks
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.161_0: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and said,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.162_0: “Well then, lift that legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense.”

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.191_0: When a monk has eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.192_0: he doesn’t cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk; he doesn’t speak to a regular monk to initiate a legal process against him; he doesn’t make accusations against a regular monk; he doesn’t ask a regular monk for permission to accuse him of an offense; he doesn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t remind a regular monk of an offense; he doesn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.193_0: When a monk has these eight qualities, a procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense should be lifted:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.194_0: The group of forty-three on to be lifted in regard to the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.195_0: “And this is how it should be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.196_0: The monk Channa should approach the Sangha, put his upper robes over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.197_0: ‘Venerables, the Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting me for not making amends for an offense, but I have conducted myself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released. I ask for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.’
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.198_0: And they should ask a second
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.200_0: A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.202_0: The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense. He has conducted himself properly and suitably so as to deserve to be released, and now asks for the legal procedure of ejection to be lifted.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.203_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should lift the legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.207_0: The Sangha lifts the legal procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.208_0: Any monk who approves of lifting the legal procedure of ejecting the monk Channa for not making amends for an offense should remain silent.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.218_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:31.1.219_0: The sixth section on the legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.0_0: The legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.2_0: At that time the monk Ariṭṭha, the ex-vulture-killer, had the following bad and erroneous view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.3_0: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.4_0: A number of monks heard that Ariṭṭha had that view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.5_0: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are unable to obstruct one who indulges in them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.7_0: They went to him and asked,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.9_0: ‘As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them’?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.1.10_0: “Yes, indeed. As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstructive are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.2_0: They should correct him, “No, don’t misrepresent the Buddha, for it’s not good to misrepresent the Buddha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.3_0: for it’s not good to misrepresent him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.4_0: The Buddha would never say such a thing.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.5_0: The Buddha has given many discourses about the obstructive things being obstructive
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.6_0: and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.7_0: The Buddha says that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.8_0: With the similes of a skeleton ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.9_0: similar to a piece of meat,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.11_0: similar to a pit of coals ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.15_0: similar to a knife and chopping block,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.17_0: a snake’s head, the Buddha has said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.18_0: But even though the monks corrected Ariṭṭha in this way, he stubbornly held on to that bad and erroneous view, and continued to insist on it.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.2.19_0: “Yes, indeed. As I understand the Buddha’s Teaching, the things he calls obstructive are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.1_0: Since they were unable to make him give up that view, they went to the Buddha and told him what had happened.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.2_0: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned Ariṭṭha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.3_0: “Is it true, Ariṭṭha, that you have such a view?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.4_0: ‘As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them’?”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.6_0: “Foolish man, whom do you think I have taught like this?
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.7_0: Haven’t I given many discourses about the obstructive things being obstructive
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.8_0: and how they obstruct one who indulges in them.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.9_0: I’ve said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.10_0: With the similes of a skeleton ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.11_0: similar to a piece of meat ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.13_0: similar to a pit of coals ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.17_0: similar to a knife and chopping block ...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.19_0: a snake’s head, I’ve said that sensual pleasures give little gratification and much suffering and distress, and they are all the more full of drawbacks.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.20_0: And yet, foolish man, by misunderstanding you have misrepresented me, hurt yourself, and made much demerit.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.21_0: This will be for your long-lasting harm and suffering.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.22_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.24_0: he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.25_0: “Well then, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.3.26_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.1_0: And this is how it should be done.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.2_0: First you should accuse the monk Ariṭṭha. He should then be reminded of what he has done, before he is charged with an offense. A competent and capable monk should then inform the Sangha:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.3_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.4_0: The monk Ariṭṭha, the ex-vulture-killer, has the following bad and erroneous view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.5_0: “As I understand the Teaching of the Buddha, the things he calls obstructive are not able to obstruct one who indulges in them.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.6_0: He is not giving up that view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.7_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should do a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.8_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.10_0: Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.11_0: The monk Ariṭṭha, the ex-vulture-killer, has the following bad and erroneous view:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.22_0: The monk Ariṭṭha, the ex-vulture-killer, has the following bad and erroneous view:

ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.32_0: The Sangha approves and is therefore silent. I will remember it thus.’”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.33_0: Monks, you should proclaim from monastery to monastery
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.34_0: ‘The Sangha has done a legal procedure of ejecting Ariṭṭha for not giving up a bad view,
ai-pli-tv-kd11:32.4.35_0: prohibiting him from living with the Sangha.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.2_0: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done without questioning the accused, it is done without the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.3_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.4_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.5_0: it is done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it is done against one who has confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.6_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having accused the person of their offense, it is done without having reminded the person of their offense, it is done without having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.7_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done in the absence of the accused, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.16_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and not properly resolved: it is done without having charged the person with their offense, it is done illegitimately, it is done by an incomplete assembly.”
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.17_0: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.18.1_0: “When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.19_0: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done with the questioning of the accused, it is done with the admission of the accused.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.20_0: When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.21_0: When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.22_0: it is done against one who has committed an offense, it is done against one who has committed an offense that is clearable by confession, it is done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.23_0: When a procedure of ejection for not recognizing an offense has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done after having accused the person of their offense, it is done after having reminded the person of their offense, it is done after having charged the person with their offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.24_0: “When a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has another three qualities, it is also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved: it is done in the presence of the accused, it is done legitimately, it is done by a unanimous assembly.

ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.33_0: When a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view has three qualities, it is legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly resolved:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.34_0: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of ejection for not giving up a bad view is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.35.1_0: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.36_0: he is quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.37_0: he is ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether he has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.38_0: he is constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.39_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.40_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.41_0: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.42_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.43_0: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.44_0: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.45_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.46_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.47_0: those who are quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.48_0: those who are ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, incapable of determining whether they have has committed an offense;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.49_0: those who are constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.50_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.51_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.52_0: those who have failed in the higher morality; those who have failed in conduct; those who have failed in view.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.53_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.54_0: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view against another three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.55_0: those who disparage the Buddha; those who disparage the Teaching; those who disparage the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.56_0: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense against three kinds of monks:
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.57_0: The group of six on wishing in regard to a legal procedure of ejection for not making amends for an offense is finished.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.58.1_0: “A monk who has had a legal procedure of ejection for not giving up a bad view done against himself should conduct himself properly.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.60_0: He should not give the full ordination.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.61_0: He should not give formal support.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.62_0: He should not have a novice monk attend on him.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.63_0: He should not accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.64_0: Even if appointed, he should not instruct the nuns.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.65_0: He should not commit the same offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not giving up a bad view;
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.66_0: He should not commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not making amends for an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.67_0: He should not commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of ejecting him for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.68_0: He should not criticize the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.69.1_0: He should not criticize those who did the procedure.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.70_0: he should not cancel the observance-day procedure of a regular monk.
ai-pli-tv-kd11:33.1.71_0: He should not cancel the invitation procedure of a regular monk.
